ExperienceSummary.Description: The candidate is experienced in:  Marketing; and Information Technology. The candidate appears to be an entry-level candidate, with 0 months of experience.
ExperienceSummary.ManagementStory:
Title: ART DIRECTOR for RISKAFRICA MAGAZINE/RISK AFRICA TV/LANDROVER MAGAZINE
	Title: Head of Creative for PHOENIX CREATIVE

Positions.Description:
Working on design, development, art direction, creation, writing, photography,

videography and all creative aspects throughout the company.

concept, design, layout and pre-press of full print magazines. Re-formatting, design and layout of digital versions. for Joomag and Wordpress. Updating of blogs and SEO tagging. Traffic, sourcing
of and preparation of artwork for client advertisements and magazine content. Design of new ads, internal

marketing material and online material. Copy writing and wordsmithing for both print and digital content.


E3 GROUP OF COMPANIES
•   Rebranding of entire company, from marketing strategy - through all marketing deliverables. Art direction,
brand development, launch video, launch event. The scope of this project has covered concept, planning,
design, development, print, video, web and other media. I have been involved with the cient and all
external vendors on this project in terms of managing and directing flow and implementation of varying
stages of the brand development and launch, right through to completion. Photography as required.

•   Contracted to re-brand the entire group. Assist and co-ordinate in launch of new brand, as well as directing
and creating material for the E3 CBC, Thermal Launch Event". Revise and re-design of all marketing material,
including vehicle branding, corporate wear and design of new website.

PANACHE PARTNERS (also previously fulltime when in the USA)

•   Contracted to work on various Coffee Table Books, from concept, design, development through to print
preparation, as well as preparing files for online viewing. Books go to Amazon, Barnes and Noble, and various other distributors/retailers. I worked remotely on this project as the client is in the USA.


   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   |    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   |    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  
design by mish

design by mish


COZA PRODUCTIONS

•	Contracted to do PR write up for the E3 Group of Companies "CBC, Thermal Launch Event", for various
media groups and publications.


ACTIVE ORGANICS | ART SQUAD | IMPRIMIS | DALLAS MORNING NEWS

CREATIVE | ART DIRECTOR

•	CONCEPT AND DESIGN OF NEW PRODUCT PIECES
•	PROOF READING AND EDITING
•	AD DEVELOPMENT
•	BROCHURES AND MARKETING PIECE DEVELOPMENT
•	PRODUCT PHOTOGRAPHY
•	PRE-PRESS
•	QUALITY CONTROL
•	TRADE SHOW GRAPHICS
•	PACKAGING DESIGN
•	POP
•	LENTICULAR DESIGN
•	MAGAZINE INSERTS AND ADVERTS

Working on individual contracts, on a client to client basis, involved taking full initiative in researching,
copywriting, checking current trends in various markets, designing marketable and informative through the line
pieces, packaging for retail. Working with outside vendors in print, public relations, material sourcing etc.
Working with upper management, company owners and marketing staff. Developing pieces that can easily
crossover onto different media platforms, while maintaining relevancy and impact.


FULL TIME POSITIONS

PANACHE PARTNERS | 2004-2008 (as well as current contract) | Dallas, | CREATIVE | ART DIRECTOR

•	ART DIRECTION
•	PROJECT MANAGEMENT
•	TEAM MANAGEMENT
•	CONCEPT DESIGN OF NEW PRODUCTS LAYOUT OF COFFEE TABLE BOOKS
•	PHOTOGRAPHY
•	AD DEVELOPMENT
•	BROCHURES AND MARKETING PIECES
•	PRE-PRESS LOCAL AND OFF-SHORE QUALITY CONTROL

My position at Panache involved a high degree of project management, and adhering to strict design protocols,
which I was integral in developing. As a new company, I was brought in at ground level, and started out as a
designer, quickly moving up the ranks to Senior Designer, and then Art Director. Hiring and training of new staff,
as well as working closely with marketing, management, and editorial staff; preparing quarterly staff reviews
and yearly departmental projection; being a part of the concept and design process, and working directly with
clientele were all a part of the many hats I wore.


www.designbymish.carbonmade.com | www.wix.com/designbymish/designbymish | www.flickr.com/designbymish
design by mish


AVIDGOLFER MAGAZINE | 2001-2004 | Irving, TX | SR. GRAPHIC DESIGNER

•	GRAPHIC DESIGN
•	WEBMASTER
•	NEW ADVERTISEMENT DESIGN
•	SPECIAL PROJECTS
•	CONTENT LAYOUT
•	CONTENT RESEARCH

I started out as a designer and was soon promoted to Senior Designer. As a senior designer for Avidgolfer
magazine, I was heavily involved in the production, timely receipt, and design of materials involved in a monthly
editorial. Part and parcel was working closely with the Art Director, being involved in photo-shoots, researching
current trends, special interest pieces, new products and stories for inclusion. I was also responsible for the
design, production and proofing of the special segment portion.


FINE PRINT INC | 1999-2001 Dallas, TX | LEAD/SENIOR DESIGNER

•	PRINT AND WEB DESIGN
•	E-FLYERS
•	PROMOTIONAL MATERIAL
•	PRE PRESS
•	PRODUCTION
•	PHOTOGRAPHY
•	MANAGING BILLING
•	MANAGING ADDITIONAL DESIGNER ART DIRECTION

I started out as a Junior Designer and was promoted to Head Designer after 4 months. This position involved a large
amount of self management and timely distribution and management of workload. Large volumes of time sensitive
material, each needing to be priced and worked within budget on a daily basis. Development of new material, and
enhancing and re-development of existing materials with limited time and resources was not uncommon, leading
to a need for thinking outside the box and coming up with new and fresh ways to achieve high end goals.

*NOTABLE | Future repeat client contracts were aquired through this position.

LAST POSITION PRIOR TO USA MOVE | South Africa | 1996-1998

NEWSCLIP MEDIA MONITORING AGENCY	  Johannesburg, SA

•	TOP 100 ACCOUNT MANAGEMENT
•	QUALITY CONTROL
•	NEW BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT
•	FOLLOWING MEDIA COVERAGE ON TOP 100 CLIENTS
•	REPORT WRITING
•	PRESENTATION OF STATISTIC MATERIAL
•	PREPARATION OF PRESENTATION MATERIAL & CUSTOMER SERVICE

SENIOR MARKETING/CLIENT LIASON

* NOTABLE | Top performing Cliant Liason in both existing and new business development.

Findings.Message: We detected that this document contained at least some data that was laid out as columns or tables. We rearranged that data to make it more usable. NEVER use columns or tables in a resume.

We found no valid start and end dates for the jobs in your work history. Each job must have a start date and an end date, preferably at the start of the line, and written as MONTH YYYY - MONTH YYYY. Never use dates that include the 'day' part.
You should not use the PDF format for your resume. Due to inherent limitations with text extraction from PDFs, you are less likely to get a job when using a PDF resume.
A first and last name was not found in the contact information. A resume should always include the candidate's first and last name.
These sections are longer than the work history and education sections combined. This may indicate a problem with section headers, formatting, or content.
Each section type should only appear once in a resume.
A phone number was not found in the contact information. A resume should always include a phone number.
A street level address was not found in the contact information. A full contact address should always be included in a resume as it allows for location based searches.
Every position in a resume should have a start date.
Every position in a resume should have an end date, unless it is a currently held position.
We found no work history positions within the past year. A resume should include work history information, including time off, for the most recent year.
Every degree in a resume should be associated with a school.

The following section was identified as a skills section type: 'BUSINESS SKILLS'. Skills should not be in a separate section, but instead, each skill should be included in the descriptions of work history or education. THIS IS INCREDIBLY IMPORTANT FOR AI MATCHING ALGORITHMS
Every section should have a clear, unambiguous, commonly-used header on a separate line directly above the content associated with it.

ResumeMetadata.PlainText:
"I seek out challenge, within a dynamic organization, that will present
me with opportunities to leverage my skills in a manner that will be
mutually beneficial, producing results that have creative longevity."

michele cunningham-scott •    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  


EDUCATION

4 Year Degree in Commercial Art
2 Year Diploma in Creative Writing

RELATED EXPERIENCE | CONTRACT AND FULL TIME

I have done freelance work for various companies and institutions over the span of my career, ranging from logo
design, packaging, branding, web graphics, web design, posters, trade-show graphics, publications, booklets,
fliers, editorial content development, photography, art direction, creative direction, project management,
hiring of staff, promotional material, book covers, magazine development, book layout and training materials
amongst other things.

| CURRENT FULL TIME | PHOTODELI & NETSPORT MOBILE MEDIA

•   ART DIRECTOR / SENIOR DESIGNER & HEAD OF DIGITAL PUBLISHING / UI AND UX DESIGN
My responsibilities include all new concept design of both print and digital media, including personalised
coffee table books for high end customers for both print and digital. On the strictly mobile side, I
have designed a mobile platform, from branding through to user interface, scrolling video banners, and
visualy stimulating iconography. My work appears online, on coffee tables, and in magazines, including
World Swimsuit - previously Sports Illustrated.

FREELANCE WORK TO VARIOUS ORGANIZATIONS -

RISKAFRICA MAGAZINE/RISK AFRICA TV/LANDROVER MAGAZINE

•   ART DIRECTOR - Working on design, development, art direction, creation, writing, photography,

videography and all creative aspects throughout the company.


PHOENIX CREATIVE

•   Head of Creative. concept, design, layout and pre-press of full print magazines. Re-formatting, design and
layout of digital versions. for Joomag and Wordpress. Updating of blogs and SEO tagging. Traffic, sourcing
of and preparation of artwork for client advertisements and magazine content. Design of new ads, internal

marketing material and online material. Copy writing and wordsmithing for both print and digital content.


E3 GROUP OF COMPANIES

•   Rebranding of entire company, from marketing strategy - through all marketing deliverables. Art direction,
brand development, launch video, launch event. The scope of this project has covered concept, planning,
design, development, print, video, web and other media. I have been involved with the cient and all
external vendors on this project in terms of managing and directing flow and implementation of varying
stages of the brand development and launch, right through to completion. Photography as required.

•   Contracted to re-brand the entire group. Assist and co-ordinate in launch of new brand, as well as directing
and creating material for the E3 CBC, Thermal Launch Event". Revise and re-design of all marketing material,
including vehicle branding, corporate wear and design of new website.

PANACHE PARTNERS (also previously fulltime when in the USA)

•   Contracted to work on various Coffee Table Books, from concept, design, development through to print
preparation, as well as preparing files for online viewing. Books go to Amazon, Barnes and Noble, and
various other distributors/retailers. I worked remotely on this project as the client is in the USA.

NEWSCLIP MEDIA MONITORING AGENCY	  Johannesburg, SA

•	TOP 100 ACCOUNT MANAGEMENT
•	QUALITY CONTROL
•	NEW BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT
•	FOLLOWING MEDIA COVERAGE ON TOP 100 CLIENTS
•	REPORT WRITING
•	PRESENTATION OF STATISTIC MATERIAL
•	PREPARATION OF PRESENTATION MATERIAL & CUSTOMER SERVICE

SENIOR MARKETING/CLIENT LIASON

* NOTABLE | Top performing Cliant Liason in both existing and new business development.

ADDITIONAL EXPERIENCE

Additional work experience gathered over a nineteen-year work span includes marketing skills, promotional
skills, sales, project management, proof reading, editing, and workflow management, staff management and
training, mentoring, art and creative direction, photography, budgeting, market research, packaging design,
and a can do attitude!


   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   |    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   |    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  
design by mish


IN CLOSING

I offer old-fashioned work-ethic, spiced liberally with modern perspective, as well as excellent prioritization and
leadership abilities developed over years of local, and international work experience--and through balancing
rigorous academic and employment objectives.

I am professionally committed and responsible, adapt easily to new situations, and successfully handle a wide
range of functions, using a combination of creative, organizational, writing, marketing, and management skills.

I maintain focus in demanding work environments and under deadline conditions. I meet challenges head-on
and always find ways to effectively complete multiple assignments or tasks.

For the past ten years I have been immersed in the publishing and print industry. I have worked closely with
designers, editors, marketing staff, local and off-shore printers, members of management, and company owners. I
have helped develop company systems, strategies and have implemented essential quality control procedures.

My commitment is one of ownership and integrity.
